content.question: Which of the following is true of John Marshall’s decision in McCulloch v. Maryland?

choices.label: It reversed his position on judicial review taken in Marbury v. Madison.
It increased federal authority by invoking the doctrine of implied powers.
It declared the Yazoo land claims fraudulent.
It granted individual states the right to regulate interstate commerce.
It found that Georgia’s laws regulating the Cherokee Indians were constitutional.

content.answer: It increased federal authority by invoking the doctrine of implied powers.

topic.text: 4.2: The Rise of Political Parties and the Era of Jefferson
